user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_BSP_EndTest:
```c
void UT_BSP_EndTest(const UtAssert_TestCounter_t *TestCounters)
{
    char Message[128];

    /*
     * Only output a "summary" if there is more than one test Segment.
     * Otherwise it is a duplicate of the report already given.
     */
    if (TestCounters->TestSegmentCount > 1)
    {
        UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport("SUMMARY", TestCounters);
    }

    snprintf(Message, sizeof(Message), "COMPLETE: %u tests Segment(s) executed\n\n",
             (unsigned int)TestCounters->TestSegmentCount);

    UT_BSP_Lock();
    OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl(Message, strlen(Message));
    UT_BSP_Unlock();

    if ((TestCounters->CaseCount[UTASSERT_CASETYPE_FAILURE] > 0) ||
        (TestCounters->CaseCount[UTASSERT_CASETYPE_TSF] > 0) || (TestCounters->CaseCount[UTASSERT_CASETYPE_TTF] > 0))
    {
        OS_BSP_SetExitCode(OS_ERROR);
    }
    else
    {
        OS_BSP_SetExitCode(OS_SUCCESS);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function UT_BSP_EndTest:
typedef struct
{
    uint32 TestSegmentCount;
    uint32 TotalTestCases;
    uint32 CaseCount[UTASSERT_CASETYPE_MAX];
} UtAssert_TestCounter_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport("SUMMARY", TestCounters);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: UT_BSP_EndTest declares TestCounters as const UtAssert_TestCounter_t * so the pointer already points to a const-qualified type. This satisfies MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. (Note: a violation would occur if UtAssert_DoTestSegmentReport were declared to take a non-const pointer and the code forced a discard of the const qualifier.)
